This type of carbyne is of considerable interest to nanotechnology as its
Young's modulus is forty times that of diamond, the hardest known material.
  S. Itzhaki, E. Altus, H. Basch, S. Hoz (2005), Harder than diamond:
     Determining the cross-sectional area and Young's modulus of molecular rods.
     Angewandte Chemie Int. Edition, volume 44, pages 7432â7435  It has
     also been identified in interstellar space. However its existence has been
     contested recently, as it has become clear that such chains would be
     extremely unstable in condensed form, as they would crosslink
     exothermically (explosively indeed) if they approached each other.
